alert.note: Alert for Jasper (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 5:41PM EDT until April 05 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF BRYAN...EFFINGHAM...CHATHAM AND JASPER COUNTIES... At 540 PM EDT, a confirmed tornado was located over Eden, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Law enforcement confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include: Pooler, Springfield, Savannah International Airport, Godley Station, Downtown Savannah, Rincon, Garden City, Port Wentworth, Hardeeville, Bloomingdale, Guyton, Eden, Tarboro, Stillwell and Purysburgh. This warning includes the following interstates: I-16 between mile markers 140 and 154. I-516 between mile markers 8 and 9. I-95 in South Carolina between mile markers 2 and 13. I-95 in Georgia between mile markers 102 and 112. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
